== Who I am ==

My name is Tim Whisonant, and I have been a member of the Ubuntu Kernel Team
since October 2024.

* I earned a Bachelor of Science in Computer Science with a minor in Mathematics at Clemson University, May 1999.
* I earned a Master of Science in Computer Science at Clemson University, December 2000.

== My Ubuntu story ==

My first interaction with Ubuntu occurred at a previous employer.  The project we worked on targeted Ubuntu as one of its release platforms.  I remember using ISO images to create virtual machines to develop and test our software running in VMWare on a Windows host.  Ubuntu always felt familiar and welcoming.  Easy to install, yet feature-rich and powerful.  It became my daily driver.  I was thrilled to read that Ubuntu would be supported natively by WSL.  Once it was released, I installed WSL and created a nice new container running Ubuntu with native kernel support all in Windows.  Amazing times!

Today, Ubuntu continues to be my daily driver, although now I'm running it on both baremetal hosts and in WSL2.  Ubuntu continues to provide that easy and comfortable yet powerful feeling, natively supporting all the software I depend on to be productive.  It has now been my pleasure to be able to give back by contributing to Ubuntu as a developer.  I look forward to doing so for the foreseeable future.

=== My involvement ===

In addition to being a kernel cranker for the Google Cloud Project on the Kernel team, I've also contributed to some of the tools and documentation.  I have reviewed several patches on the Kernel team mailing list and have contributed to the CVE backlog.  During bug squad in early 2025, I was able to both contribute an <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/2098063|upstream cherry pick]]</nowiki> to our Noble kernel and to successfully bisect an issue to <nowiki>[[https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/+source/linux/+bug/2098961|identify an upstream bug]]</nowiki>.

I have also developed a handful of tools that help with my daily work, mainly around organizing my workspace to track bugs, mailing list reviews, CVE work, etc.

==== Other Kernels ====

bionic:linux-azure-4.15 for cycle s2024.12.02, reviewed by Jacob Martin. A respin of jammy:linux-gcp during the 2025.01.13 cycles. A respin of focal:linux-gcp during the 2025.02.10 cycle.

=== Things I could do better ===

* I hope to improve at backporting kernel patches.  I've not had any work experience related to backporting in previous roles, so there's room for improvement.
* As a hobby, I'm looking into operating system internals; and I'd like to become proficient in x86 protected mode hardware/software interaction, writing my own kernel.

== Plans for the future ==

* I want to continue to provide an excellent customer experience to the Google Cloud Project.
* I'd like to become more familiar with our cranking tools and their implementations in order to contribute more bug fixes and features.
* I'd like to contribute to the organization and packaging of our tools as PIP-installable packages.

==== Specific Experiences of working together ====

Based on the work we have done together, I trust him to do a good job and endorse him for kernel upload rights.
